content.detailedDescription: On july 4th 2008 at around 11:30 pm cst my family and i noticed a very bright orange object flying in the sky at a fairly low altitude while we were shooting fireworks. we were all in the driveway of our home supervising our kids as they were shooting fireworks. we live in a subdivision of lots of houses and our house is very close to a very busy highway. there were 8 of us that witnessed this object and i do have video of it. the witnesses were myself (37), my wife (34), my mother in law, my daughter (15) and her friend, and my son (8) and his friend. all of us witnessed the object. we saw it 3 different times in about a 20 minute period, witnessing it for about 2 minutes at a time. it made no sound and was definitely not an airplane, helicopter or hot air balloon. i did not know what the object was but i was glad i was witnessing it and am very curious to know what it was. the first time we saw it, it was flying from the north northeast to the south then turning and flying northeast at a fairly low speed. i was standing in my driveway watching the object and also recording it with my camcorder. the second time we saw it coming from the south flying east to northeast. the third time we saw it flying again from the north to south then turning and flying northeast. it was a very beautiful orange color that seemed to glow. the farther away from us the object flew its orange light got dimmer and dimmer until we couldn't see it anymore. this is how we knew it was flying away from us. we did not see the object again and finished up our fireworks a few minutes later around midnight. after uploading the video from my mini-dvd camcorder to my computer and zooming in on the object you can clearly see the object was changing colors, blue, red, green, white, and some purple.
content.shape: Circle,  Fireball,  Oval,  Saturn-like,  Other,  Unknown
content.summary: Very bright glowing orange object flying in the sky on july 4th 2008.

content.detailedDescription:
The first time i saw it i was letting the dog out in the front garden, i looked west in the sky and saw a white orb moving slowly easterly in the sky. it was just there in the sky, at first i thought it was a plane until i saw it rappidly change direction moving north west but staying at the same speed. at this point i knew it couldnt be a plane or helicopter so i called my friend who was with me downstairs at the time to see. then we both whitnessed the object suddenly changed colour to red then change to green and shot directly up northwards at incredible speed and faded out, the object made no sound nor did it leave any trail. this was the first time we saw the object.




the second time we saw it was about 15 minutes later and it was about another 2-3 miles north away from original sighting. this time it was white again and just hovering still. it lookded smaller. my friend commented that it was a star until it suddenly turned green and shot of at speed from standtill in a straight line to the east, i ran through house to back garden to see it dissapear out of veiw behind houses.

again, the object made no sound nor did it leave any trail and both times it just suddenly turned from white red green, white green before zooming off - we were both quite shocked by this as it did not appear to be our technology.

i did manage to take a picture of it the second time but it just looks like a star in the sky, this was before it moved off, green at incredible speed.

i also managed to get a short video clip of it the second time but you can not see it on the video as it too dark.

i estimate it easily covered 20 miles of sky from standstill in about 7 seconds before going out view.


i will attach the picture of the object (the 2nd time we saw it and this is an actual picture of the object 'pic 1') and a photo of the location we 1st saw it in (i took this picture a bit later and i have added the orbs to give a better description of what we saw. 'pic 2')
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Object was initally white, then red for a brief moment, then the 2 times it zoomed off it was green

content.detailedDescription:
We were in yosemite national park, tuoleme meadows area on top of lembert dome.  the family was taking in the scenery and i was taking pictures of them.  once i uploaded the pictures to my desktop computer, we noticed the object (?) in the sky.  the day was crystal clear, blue sky, with no clouds and we were at about 9800 feet above sea level.  when i first saw the pictures and the spot, i thought it was a spot on the lense or light refraction off the top of lembert dome. it couldn't be a spot on the lense since i took a few pictures in between the three that had the object and there was nothing on those.  i still think it could be light refraction off my camera lens but there is purple shadowing on the forest trees below us (in pictures #2 and #3) and there seems to be some density to the image.  it also looks like it is beaming down on the people in the photos.  no one saw or heard anything and my family thinks i'm silly to think it is anything but light refraction.  i just thought i'd ask (after all these years) and see what you guys think.  i am sending you the original photos, untouched.  if you need any other information please feel free to contact me.  thanks for taking the time to review the photos for i know you are very busy.
best regards,
p.S.  i hope i am sending these to the correct place.  i figured the local mufon chapter would be a good place to start.
content.summary: We did not see the object but it showed up in photos taken at the time.

content.detailedDescription: My son(5 at the time) and i were driving to pick a friend up to take to the airport. it was daytime, mabey 1pm. i was on the cell phone trying to find his exact location and we came up to an street intersection. i looked up mabey 75-100 feet above the stop lights to see a hovering craft that was spinning and wobbling. my son was looking at it too! i told my friend on the phone what we were seeing. he laughed at me. i'm surprised no cars were pulling over. everyone was ignoring it and going on with there business. i had to turn left at the light, so i lost it. my son said it took off really fast! it really did look fake like the old 1950's ufo photo's that you see. but it was not fake. it was metal, i don't remember it being shiny though, it was dull like an old pie tin i guess. my son drew a picture of what he saw. his eyes are much better than mine and he actually saw the port holes on the thing. i tried to call the police that evening to report it, but they didnt really care. at arms length it was the size of a football.
content.summary: Hovering saucer craft above intersection

content.detailedDescription:
This story was on msnbc , about a bird hitting a northwest airline,in air and damageing the nose of the plane , very odd here's the link to the page , 
http://www.Abclocal.Go.Com/wpvi/story?Section=news/national_world&id=6249022
 i had to really look for the story again , because it was hard to find. the story ,said a northwest airline hit something in the air, and they are saying it was a bird, at 18000 feet, and dented the nose of the plane, a person waiting to take next flight saw the plane on the runway. he said it had a smashed-in nose and looked like it crashed into a wall. this was reported on 07-07-08
content.summary: Unknown

content.detailedDescription: We were just enjoying our backyard with kids and the neighbors. i looked up to see a bird fly by and noticed a very bright star object way way way high up. i had everyone looking at it and watching it on and off for about 30 mins ( 6 witnesses). it slowly moved toward the northwest from my house. at arms length it was the size of a bright star at night. bright white. very high altitude. i looked at it throught the binoculars, and only saw a bright completely round circle. after all the excitement was over, the neighbor boy spotted it again way over the mountains northeast, this time, and it was blinking. again we watched on and off for 20-30 minutes until it finally faded away. same size as the other one and color, but flashing on off, on off. i always look to the sky to see cool stuff. i have seen other ufo's in the past that i will post here also.  we are in the path of the airport, planes landing all day, and i will say we all agreed it was not an airplane.
content.summary: Pure blue sky, sunday afternoon ufo like a bright star

content.detailedDescription: On sunday, 6/29/2008, at approximately 10:15pm, i was sitting on my porch having a cigarette. i often look up to the sky to watch the stars. on this particular night, i looked up to the sky and saw what i thought was the brightest star ever. i continued to watch it. i was going to get my husband but it was only there for a few moments then suddenly moved behind the clouds. it continued to move northeast, then it was gone. i thought this to be strange and kept wondering what it could have been. my boss was talking one day at work and mentioned seeing something quite similar on the same night and around the same time.
content.summary: Saw star-like object in sky; it then moved behind the clouds and continued moving northeast.

content.detailedDescription: Object appeared on multiple nights in the night sky.  the object moves around and emits what looks like "fairy dust" only to be sucked back up into the craft.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Object appeared in night sky.

content.detailedDescription: Egg shaped ufo in a v-form flew over as the witness was out on his deck smoking a cigar.  the craft was flying flat & straight.  it stopped and did not twist or tilt and came straight down like an elevator.  it stopped below the clouds for a second and flew off.  the craft was a steady white light which was real bright.  the witness' deck is on the 2nd floor of an apartment in a complex that faces the target retail store's parking lot that is beyond the old don pablos restaurant site.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Egg shaped ufo in a v-form flew over.

content.detailedDescription:
I was on a brake at work , i was with a co worker having a smoke when i was looking up at the sky , it was a clear day when i noticed a very larg object , as soon as i seen this my mind started to try to identify this by comparison to convencinal air craft to no conclusion the size and shape made no sence , this is when i made a coment to my co worker "whats that" , he looked and wasnt realy as shocked as i was more or less might have thought was a pice of space shuttle dibree ,or a satilite..
as larg as this was it couldnt be.
here is a discription , cylinder shaped , it looked as if it was made of something shiny like mirror or crome...Was horizontile , and did not move..
it looked like a enormose cigarette .
it stayed there , i had to go back to work so that was it..
i wish i had been able to get a picture...
this is the first thing ive ever seen...
content.summary: Very large size of 3-6 empier state buildings...

content.detailedDescription:
About 2:00-pm on 7/8/2008 i visited a small private airport near me. while there i decided to take of few pictures of this airport and a few airplanes. my last picture was of flags waveing on top of a mountian on this airport property...

when i downloaded the pictures. i noticed something in the upper left hand of this picture of the flags. i did'nt see it when i took the picture. but what is it ?...Bird ?...Or ufo ?...I don't know... i use my xp pro picture magnifier to enlarge the object. helped some . but what is the obje t in the "flags" picture. i leave it up to you.  as far as i am concerned, its a ufo. ..

pictures will explain location of this airport.
content.summary: See picture with flags

content.detailedDescription: I was waching tv from my garage with the garoge door open when i looked out side i saw a hovering orb of light it stood their for like 5 sec then left real fast towards the baldy mountans.
content.summary: Orb of light

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter is a truck driver. she was taking a load to california. while traveling through vegas, whe and her son were shocked to see a ufo ahead of them, traveling above the freeway. the were going to pull over to get a better look, but they couldn't because too many others were pulled over taking pictures etc. she could not get her phone to take a picture of it. i was traveling slow enough they over took it, and got a good look of the under side. she was way excited, and called me to see if i had heard anything on the news about it. i checked every where. i called her back and it had changed directions and they had lost sight...But as we talked it came back into view.

she said it was a saucer like the ones you see in movies, with lights circling it, that were white, and on the bottom there were two red blinking (i think) lights.
content.summary: Followed us down the freeway for miles. at first headed south then north. went out of sight and came back

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside just beginning to have a smoke, when i looked at the moon and then noticed what i thought to be a bright star.  when i noticed it was moving i then thought, thats a big plane.  then as it was ascending to what appeared to be space i was in awe.  i followed the object as it appeared to turn into a satellite.  i followed its path as if it were a satellite until i was no longer able to track it with my naked eye.

thinking back it was pretty graceful and it must have been going very fast.

the thing that got me the most which thinking back kinda excludes a helicopter or plane is that i've watched satellites moving in orbit before and that is exactly how the object moved at the end of my viewing.

if i had to estimate it must have been no longer than 14 secs for the entire viewing.

there were two other planes across the sky i noticed after my viewing.  they had red flashing lights.
content.summary: Strange ascending object viewed as it turned into what appeared a satellite.

content.detailedDescription:
I was working security on the morning of july 03, 2008. at 05:10 i noticed that bright star thats in the sky every morning (not sure if thats a planet or star). when i got out of the security van at 05:12 i noticed that there were now two bright stars in the sky. i thought at first it was a airplane, the site i work at is close to a airport and planes fly over all night and morning. but there were no flashing lights on this object- no running lights, collision lights or strobe lights at all. i stood there and watched the object- it had a steady bright light and was moving very slow across the sky with no noise coming from it at all. it wasnt a plane, so a satellite came to mind. but it wasnt high enough to be a satellite. i stood and watched the object for about 15 minutes until it went out of range and i couldnt see it anymore. the strange thing was that at 05:12 in the morning there is usually traffic planes in the air, but this morning there wasnt any planes until the object was gone.
now im not sure what the object was. a real alien ufo or something else. but to me, sense i couldnt identify it, it really in all sense of the word was a ufo.
content.summary: Bright silent star like object.

content.detailedDescription: I lived in west fort worth and went out onto my 2nd floor balcony. a plane to my east caught my attention.  it was flying north to south, presumably out of dfw airport.  suddenly i saw a ball of light which appeared to be slightly behind and below the plane shoot forward extremely fast and get ahead of the plane. it turned red at the end and disappeared. my first thought was that it must have been a meteor. then i saw the light moving above the plane toward the back (it probably was a good distance away from the plane).  i lost sight of it again. i began to scan the sky and saw a red glowing object just hovering through the upper branches of some trees that were about 50 feet away to the southeast. this was much lower than when i had seen the ball of light. the object appeared darker, more solid, in the center with a see-through red glow.  it was more oval as i recall. it suddenly shot straight up, wobbled near the top of the flight, then stopped and hovered. when it shot up it was a ball of light with no hint of red. at some point it went rapidly north, stopped and hovered. then with no visible turn went rapidly south. a couple of time it went staight up and down making zig-zag moves on the way.  it made several maneuvers and i got the impression of it being defensive moves. it eventually took off to the northwest, going faster than a plane but nothing to compare with it's previous movement. i lost track of it as there were some thin clouds in that area. i knew of nothing to consider it but a ufo. the dfw naval air reserve base was about 10 miles to the northwest of me but this was certainly not like anything i had ever seen and i have lived in this area most of my life.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Ball of light below a plane, hovered low, turning red, zig zag maneuvers

content.detailedDescription:
Friends and i were at the site of an abandoned well, north, perhaps 4-5 miles, off hwy 62, between joshua tree and yucca valley (a mile or less east of yucca mesa road), far away from surrounding lights.  i don't recall any moon out that night.  i said july 15, but that's a guess.  somewhere in july or august, has to be about right, because it was still very hot, probably 95 degree f., that late at night, and the wind was hot, and characteristically out of the south for that time of year.  

i was scanning the sky, when i thought i spotted a satelite, moving from south to north, nearly directly over us, perhaps 80 degrees up from the eastern horizon.  i had seen satellites in the night sky previously, and this was about as bright as those--though the ones i had seen previously had not been in polar orbit.  the others i'd seen moved from west to east--and moved at about the same speed in comparison to background stars.  

as a child, when satellites were relatively new, i had learned to look for them at a summer camp.  a counselor had pointed one out to us, and it was not hard to see.  but it would have been hard to notice, without his use of a flashlight to illuminate the sky immediately surrounding it.  he pointed out that to be sure about it, you had to track its movement against the background stars.  

he said they could be spotted by someone who was patient and took the time to slowly scan the sky, stopping to focus on small patches, looking for movement among stationary objects.  i had spotted a couple of others over the many years intervening between that night in my childhood and this one.  i had also used the technique described to identify many obviously terrestrial aircraft, at a great distance over the many intervening years, far before friends ever spotted them.  the technique was automatic by then.  

i was about to point out the "satellite" to the entire group, having spent a minute or more verifying what i was seeing, when a friend, r, asked me what i was looking at.  after he failed to spot it with me meerely pointing at it, i pointed it out to him--using a very bright, focused beam flashlight--and he also began tracking the progress of the light.  

from the ground, it appeared slow, steady, traveling in a straight line, with a brightness slightly less than an "average" star, easily visible to the naked eye--though its motion against the background was not at all easy to see without use of the technique of gazing steadily at a small patch of sky, and looking for motion within that small area.  

like the others i'd seen previously, it was clearly there, clearly moving, slowly, in a straight line, against the background of the surrounding stars; but it would have been easy to miss, unless you just happened to look at or near it, and you were accustomed to viewing small patches of the night sky with particular attention to motion-detection.  r said he'd never have spotted it without my use of the "flashlight-pointer."

a minute or so after r began watching it, a few other friends heard us talking about it, and i tried pointing it out with my outstretched arm, and finger, as i had done previously with r, but to no avail.  so i quickly hit the spot with my flashlight again, for the  second or two that it took to turn on the light and get it directly on the spot, leaving it there long enough to make it clear the target was in the middle of where the light had steadied.  i knew that the presence of that light would degrade night vision, so i kept exposure to that light as minimal as possible.  

r and i had both acquired the target, and the light was not enough to make us lose it.  but the others never had a chance to acquire it.  as soon as the light was off, the little spot of light, still moving slowly, changed direction slightly.  before i had any chance to even think about that, it made what can only be called an instaneous acceleration, and simultaneoulsy began zig-zagging, appearing to increase its altitude as it made very sharp, pointed, zig-zags and its brightness dimished with the apparent increase in altitude, until it was no longer visible.  

r and i turned to each other, mouths both agape.  we discussed what we saw, and what we both saw was what i just described.  our skins were crawling, because we knew what we had just seen was no damned satellite.  satellites don't change direction, even slowly like that one did, at first.  even while still moving slowly, that first change of direction was perhaps along the lines of 20 degrees right, relative to previous trajectory.  they also don't accelerate instantaneously, and they certainly don't then start to zig-zag.

i tracked the object through perhaps 20-25 degrees of arc in the sky--using, as a rule of thumb, the horizontal width of a fully extended fist against the sky is 10 degrees.  r saw it for pehaps 60-70% of that travel.  the time from its first change of direction to its disappearance was 1-1.5 seconds.  from the time it started to zig-zag, to its disappearance was about a second, if not slightly less.  

the first, slow, change of direction didn't last long, maybe half a second before the first, severe change of direction occurred along with the instanteneous acceleration.  the next change was around 135 degrees right, farther still--which meant it reversed direction, and flew for a very short time in south-easterly direction, then it zigged and zagged, growing ever dimmer, until its disappearance.  there were perhaps 7-8 zigs and zags during this very short period, each around 90 degrees.

i've often tried to describe verbally what i saw, never with much satisfaction.  so, i take the time to write it here, as precisely as i can.  it was like watching a pool ball bounce between opposing, but also converging banks on a pool table, speeding up as it went, not slowing down, and becoming smaller as it went.  of course, it wasn't becoming smaller, but dimmer, instead.  

if one believes, as i do, that what i was watching was maintaining a steady size and brightness, but was only becoming dimmer due to increasing distance, the the apparent "convergence of the banks on the pool table" was an illusion similar to seeing railroad tracks converge in the distance.  my thoughts are that the zig-zag course was tightly maintained, in terms of the real distance traveled over each leg of any particular zig or zag.  of course, i have no way of verifying that.  

as that light zig-zagged out of sight, it appeared circumscribed within an angle of about 30 degrees.  not 30 degrees of sky, but as if the banks on the table were spreading out from a point at about 30 degrees of angle. from the first, severe zig, to the side of the next zag was, maybe 2.5-3 degree of arc on the background sky--growing ever smaller with each succeeding course change.  the size of the patch of sky would be around that of your thumbnail, or slightly smaller, extended at arms length against the night sky 

as i said, none of the others got a chance to see it.  about 7 or 8 years later i learned that r, who i hadn't seen in during the preceding 4-5 years, was deceased.  he had signed up for a 6 year stint in the armed services; and, tragically he had taken his own life while on duty.  so there is no surviving witness to this event, save myself, and one or two others who heard us talk about it, but didn't see it themselves.  in fact, 2 of the other 3 or 4 people who were present are also deceased--those two of more natural causes.

i know what i saw is not something explainable as some damned experimental aircraft of ours or anyone's on this planet.  not unless someone has the ability to take an object with volume and convert it into an object without mass or structure that would be torn apart by the forces of inertia that would have been generated in those severe and pointed changes in course.  any living things inside such a craft would splattered like bugs on a windshield.  it was also no natural phenomenon.

do i make a big deal about it?  no. only after i know someone very well, and if he or she brings up issues about ufo's will i venture to mention this one instance.  do i think this event had anything to do with r's death?  i couldn't say for sure, but i doubt it.  talking with mutual friends and acquaintances, it appears r had issues i'd have never known about involving an absolutely horrendous childhood.  childhood friends of his told me about them after his death when i was so mortified to hear of his suicide.  

i suppose i should mention one other instance. it was about 1974, i was about half way between joshua tree and twentynine palms, in the same general area, exept i was north of hwy 62 this time, about .6 mile--i was at our family's weekend retreat--so i know exactly how far that is off the highway.  it was mid-to-late spring.  a friend (j--who i haven't seen virtually since that time, though i'm sure a few times after that day) and i were outside.  the sky was clear and blue.  it was, pehaps 3:30 in the afternoon.  we were looking around with 7 power binoculars.  i think i was using his, which were 7x35 wide-angles, and he was using mine, which were 7x50 regular view, though i couldn't swear to that.

we were spootting aircraft, mostly, and tracking them across the sky, also birds, and also land-based objects at great distance.  i was looking north-westerly when i spotted something in the glasses that i couldn't identify.  i've never had any idea what it might have been.  it appeared to be something in the sky that was just slightly brighter (slightly whiter) than the surrounding sky.  it's shape was "fuzzy."  it had no distinct edges, though it's overall size and shape remained constant. it was eliptical, perhaps twice as long as wide.  it was easy to track, moving downwards at about 30 degrees of angle, from west to east across the sky.  

i tracked it probably across 60-75 degrees of arc through the sky.  i had been watching it for about 1.25-1.5 minutes, all the while trying to imagine what it might be, and trying to focus the glasses very slowly, for a better view, but fuzzy was the best it got.  i had made overall adjustments of focus that suggested it was getting slowly closer.  then, it changed directions, making what i'd call about a 115 degree shift in flight path, to the right.  i was still tracking one way, when it went the other, which meant it went quickly down, backtracking slightly on itself, and out of my view.  

that shift astonished me.  i couldn't say if it changed speed.  i lost it too fast to know.  i tracked one way, and it zigged the other, instaneously, like on a dime.  considering the small angle of view, wide-field or not, it was lost too quickly to say anything about a change in speed.  i couldn't think of anything that would be able to make such a turn, except maybe some sort of raptor, but this was no bird.  i was not able to spot it again.  

(and, writing this now, one thought from "science fiction" occurs to me.  what if it was something like the "switch-blade" jet in the "i spy" movie with eddie murphy and owen wilson?  something with an almost perfect invisibility cloak?  something like a technological chameleon, or some of the sea creatures that change their appearance to mimic their surrounding areas?  a clear, blue sky wouldn't be too tough to immulate.  just a thought)

i thought maybe i'd been seeing a relection of the sun off one or both of the lenses--which was no viable explanation.  the sun was west of us when i started tracking it, also to the west, but the sun was always somewhat behind my head, in the southern sky, and as i tracked this object over to the eastern part of the sky, that such a reflection could have stayed constantly there producing and anchanging apparition, if such a reflection had ever been there at all, became totally implausible.

i don't recall what i was viewing or might have been seeking to view when i first noticed it.  after a few moments, thought the desire was great, i knew trying to point it out to j would have been futile--it was in such a small patch of sky, and moving, and so hard to distinguish even with the best focus possible.  i knew if i tried pointing to it, i'd have to take my eyes and glasses off it, and that would be that.  it was not something anyone could have spotted with the naked eye.  

i had the impression it was within a mile or less, but that's more due to the quickness of it's movement across that much apparent sky, and to the focus used on the glasses than it is to having any sense of scale about the object.  it was against nothing but sky, and nothing else ever came into those few degrees of view to provide any scale.  

until the object changed directions abruptly, i was still trying to keep it steady in the field of view and feeling great curiosity about what it was.  after the change of direction, it dawned on me, that "technically" anyway, i'd just seen a ufo.  i thought about the sun, or other sources of reflection, but was unable to explain anything other than i had been watching something real that turned abruptly, and i then lost it.  i told j about it, but i made little of it to anyone else.  

if what i at first saw as a "satellite" is a 7.5 on my "richter" scale of amazing things, this "slightly whiter patch of sky" thing is, maybe a 3.0 to me.  i only mention it because it involved an instantaneous, sharp, angular change in course, of which i'm  certain, and it occurred in the same general area, though more than 5 years previously.

i've heard joshua tree, giant rock, and that whole morongo basin are supposed ufo hotspots.  i've been going out there since the early 1950's.  i've always been facinated by the night sky.  other than someone who's lived out there for many years, i probably have more time watching that sky than any casual visitors to the area you'll ever find.  and i have those two incidents to tell about.

the first incident made me wonder just what the heck i'd been seeing, and made me wonder if, perhaps, i'd seen something otherwordly.  but, i didn't take it too seriously.  the second incident left me with little doubt of it.  unless we have technology so secret that we've never used it (and it would be foolish and pointless to go to the massive expense of developing unused technology that advanced), the technology needed to produce that satellite incident was advanced way beyond anything we had then or have now.  

nothing but wildly advanced and intelligently applied technology could have produced that satellite incident, at least, not so, in my opinion.  the movements were far too precise and controlled to have occurred naturally or by any sort of chance.  perhaps r and i, a few hundreds of years ago, could have grunted to each other about "the gods," maybe even built a shrine or something.  not today, or even 30 years ago.

well, that's it, for what it's worth.  just thought i should share it with people who have more time than i do to attempt investigating this stuff.  hope it helps.  good luck.  you'll need, and i hope you have, it.
content.summary: Watching what i thought was a satellite, i was astonished to see it accelerate instantaneously and fly away, zig-zagging.

[cms/tg pid]

i was on a road trip in southeast alaska, and was going on a tour of the chilcoot pass, with my older brother. we took pictures of each other, with our backs to the water and mountains, at seperate times and locations (about an hour or so in between); from about mid-afternoon to the evening, when the sun was setting. i hadn't noticed the bright sphere-like object, and my brother didn't tell me that he had seen it (if he had). my brother was the one who took most of the pictures at the time, so i haden't realized that there was a ufo until i reveiwed the photos a couple of years after. 
   the pictures showed the bright star like object in the top right portion of the photograph; the object was too bright to be a star and too dull to be the sun. i wondered if it was a planet, but then i noticed in the last set of pictures the bright sphere fliying around like it was a mosqueto. i thought it was verry strange, and it took me a while to guess what it was until i came to the conclusion it's most likely to be a ufo.
   i wish i had acces to the photos but they are my brother's, and i don't have acces to them, instead, i have attached some sketches done on microsoft paint.
content.summary: Bright sphere floating 1000 feet above the water.

content.detailedDescription: I was born in australia in 1978. one morning in march of 1993 i believe, i was playing in the backyard when i noticed an object in the sky off in the distance. i was mesmerised by it and as i watched it noticed it was heading my way. it was completely silent and it was my first real experince with ufo's. it glided infront of me approx. 150ft in the air and i could see what looked like windows on this strange object. i watched it with amazment as it flew off into the distance until i couldnt see it anymore.
content.summary: Watched ufo fly silently from one horizon to the other.

content.detailedDescription:
this incident happened several years ago but i'm just now getting a computer to tell my story to someone. approx. 32 years ago.
 let's start out by getting the georaphy of the area. the city of metropolis has a plant on the west side of town and this plant takes u235 and converts it to u238 for nuclear weapons. this "yellowcake" is then taken to plant just across the river to a plant that refines it even more to make "only god knows what".But you get my drift it's a very sensitive area.
  myself and two friends were heading west on grand chain rd. one clear, sunny, sunday afternoon. we had just went over the cache river bridge and was coming on a rise and curve in the road. grand chain rd. sorta follows the ohio river betweem joppa.Ill. and grand chain. you can't see the ohio but just a few places along that road. as we were going up this grade ( i have been down this road hundreds of times so i knew this was a spot that you could overlook the ohio). as i was looking across the fields to the river something caught my eye up in the air. it was on the illinois side of the river (not good with judging heights) about 1000 ft. 
  well, what i saw was not a disk or light it was what appeared to be a plane. it didn't look simular to a plane, it was a plane! but i knew the instint i saw it somthing was not right. the window were not transparent. the windows looked like it had some kind of silver tinting on all the windows. and it was not moving. it was just setting there.
  i was in the back seat behind a male friend and a female friend was in  the pasenger seat. i didn't say anything i just kept looking at it. all the sudden a huge green fireball came out of this plane, streaked to the ground and exploded three times, without making a sound.The one fireball exploded three times.
  this is just the strangest part of the whole thing. after the explosions were over (never saying nothing)as i was turning my head back to the front of the car, my two friends heads were turning around at the same time. it's kinda like we were all placed in the car and woke up at the same time, or thats the feeling i got later. i'll never forget that. this all took place in a matter of 1 min. we kept going down the road and never said anthing to each other at all, to this day (7-8-08) we have never discused it. the female died of cancer about 5 years ago and we never said a word about it to each other. the male friend moved away, haven't saw him in years. it's funny, i can tell other people about it and i have told other people about it, but after a few rolled eyes, i thought it best to just keep it to myself.
  i mentioned those two nucler plant for a reason. the plant on the ky. side of the ohio was within sight of where we saw the plane.
  if you don't believe me i don't care. but i swear this on my only son's eyes. there are probably thing that i didn't write that i'll wish i would have put in here. 
  i moved to houston texas and was away for several years and when i came back i was going down that road and the state of illinois had bought that property and put a resturant on the exact same spot the green fireball landed on. that's another reason i haven't said anything over the years. it may be some kind of government thing.  
 i wish i could craw you some pictures and e-mail them to you, but i'm not that good with computers yet. hell, it took me twoo hours to type this.
content.summary: Unidentified object near nuclear facility

content.detailedDescription:
On the july 4th, 2008, my daughter and her neighbors had a huge block party with a bbq, a band and lots of fireworks. about 9:30 p.M.,i was sitting in a chair on the front lawn of a neighbor and was watching all the people dancing in the street to the music. at the same time, some of the folks were setting off the fireworks. it was quite a celebration. the air was filled with smoke from the fireworks and i was looking up in the sky at beautiful firework that had just been shot off, when something weird caught my eye. in the sky maybe a little higher than the roofs of the 2 story houses i saw an area of the sky that had what appeared to have a "ripple" in it. it looked kind of like when one sees the wavy hot air on on a highway in the summer. in this ripple was something that had pale blue lights. the lights did not blink and the lights appeared to sort of outline the object. all of this was very dim and it was difficult to make out exactly what it looked like. i had a sense that it was shaped sort of like a figure eight. the object was completely silent and moving slowly. i watched it pass over all the people dancing in the street. it appeared to be slightly tilted inward. there was a lot of smoke in the air so that added to the poor visibility. i was just mesmerized by this thing and did not want to take my eyes off of it in case i could not find it again. the party was very noisey and i knew that if i yelled at anyone to look, they probably would not hear me. 
this whole episode lasted maybe 10 seconds at the most. the rippled air and the object just disappeared as it came out of the smoke. i had the feeling that if i had been up on the top of the roof, i could have touched the object. i also felt that the smoke in the air had something to do with the fact i was able to see this thing. i probably would not have noticed it if it hadn't been for the pale blue lights that i saw.
funny thing was, i was not the slightest bit afraid or shocked.
content.summary: The object was nearly invisible but had blue lights that gave it away as it "floated" over our 4th of july celebration.

content.detailedDescription: Driving home at night with my son (17 years old), with some rain falling and a couple of flashes of lightning in the distance. on the pacific highway with cars a fair way away from me at the front. then a large  glowing red orb went in front of the car just above the height of tall trees. it was maybe the size of a car. it was about 50 metres away from the car. it went extremely quickly across the highway from right to left and disappeared behind the tree line to my left. i think they were large pine trees. i said to my son, "did you see that?" he had just caught a glimpse of it as he had not been focussing on the road as i was. he also saw a red reflection in the window but assumed it was just a light. a very short time later we both experienced being totally immersed in white light. it was an individual experience and i had no notion of my son being with me. it was as if only my consciousness was in the light. like you might imagine an out of body experience. there was nothing but intense white light that did not hurt your eyes but nothing else, no car, no steering wheel, no body even. it was a pleasant feeling. it seemed to only last a split second and i said as everything returned to normal, "did you see that?" "it felt like i was out of time and space, in another dimension." my son said he could not feel his body while in the light and felt that none of his senses (smell, touch etc) were present. he also said to me that while in the light there was no sense of time passing. he said it was as if it could have been one second or a thousand years. yet straight after it we both felt it had only been a split second. we both said to each other that it was the weirdest experience we had ever had and were looking for an explanation. the radio had been playing in the car when this happened but we both could not hear anything while in the white light. when the white light left the radio was back on as if it had never stopped but my son said that it sounded odd as if the song had changed. we continued to drive and convinced ourselves that the car had been struck by lightning even though there had been no sound and the lightning was far away in the distance. we got within 15 minutes drive of our house, in the town of murwillumbah (population 7000) and as we turned a corner with sugar cane growing on either side of the road, both noticed a very low bright star hovering over the township. it was very low as i thought it could have been a light plane as it was about the height of a crop duster. since it wasn't moving and was very bright we pulled over to the side of the road to look at it and try and work out what it was. we then realised it was actually moving horizontally at an extremely slow speed so it looked like it was stationary. it was the brightest object in the sky. we tried to convince ourselves that it was some sort of odd plane but then it rose vertically  and partially disappeared behind low cloud. it just sat there for at least 5 minutes. suddenly it zoomed off at great speed over the top of the car and we lost sight of it. we then returned home expecting to go in and for it to be around 7 pm since we had left on an hour and a half journey at about 5.30. i was totally amazed and confused to see that the time was 7.45. we had stopped for 5 minutes to get petrol at the start of the trip and had  stopped at the side of the road for about 5 minutes to look at the star object. we are both at a loss to explain how we lost all this time, as well as the two objects we saw and the white light.
content.summary: Saw red orb ufo, star ufo, pure white light and lost about 30 minutes of time.

content.detailedDescription: Was in kindergarden at the time when the bell rang to go back to class...When i was running back to the room i had a great sensation that some one was looking down at me and i stopped in my tracks and looked strait up..I saw a round object blending into the blue of the sky..The object was a silver whitish looking and there was a circle of black dots toward the center of the object..It wasn't a blimp from moffet field i remember those  and it wasnt the moon....If  you didnt know where to look in the sky you probaly would never had seen it...I looked up and and saw it imeadiatly...The teacher finaly called me into class.... when i got home that afternoon before entering my home i looked up and it was still there..That must of been 2 or 3 hours later.
content.summary: Saw circle shape object 12 oclock high day time

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting outside with my daughter at our campfire while camping at harrisville state park in michigan. around 11pm, i looked up into the sky and saw a fiery ball crossing the sky from west to east. at first i thought it was a meteor but it was quite large (about the size of a dime), and did not streak or throw off sparks. i was quite puzzled about what i was seeing. it progressed slowly and steadily across the sky. my daughter and i ran a few feet to the beach to get an unobstructed view as it crossed the sky over lake huron. it seemed to hover for a minute or 2 and move sideways back and forth for a while. it then moved more quickly across the sky until it was no longer visible towards the horizon. it was silent and did not appear to have lights of any kind except the fiery glow. i have know idea what this might have been but if anyone has any ideas i'd like to hear them!
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I saw a fiery ball slowly crossing the sky that i thought at first was a meteor. it moved slowly / steadily. i  watched it cross the sky over lake huron.

content.detailedDescription:
I wish i could say that i had a witness to what i am about to explain happened last year in the sky right above my house, but unfortunatley i was alone that night when it happened.
i had been timing satalites going over my house and know about the time to come out and watch them on a nightly basis.
they pass so gently across the sky and are absolutley spactacular to watch as they gracefully move across the sky.
as the third one passed directly above our house that night, i noticed a star like object with a bright shade of blue that i had never seen before move quickly into a holding position as the satalite gracefully moved across the sky.

i could not beleive what i was seeing and wished there was someone around to show this to at the time....
it stayed in the same spot for about 15 minutes and in a blink of an eye, it screamed across the sky at a blinding speed taking a perfectly streight path out of sight?
at that point, i knew immediatly that i had just witnessed a u.F.O. for the first time in my life! an emotion flooded over me of extreame inferiority.

in the marine corps i had witnessed many different missles being fired and they move in slow motion compared to the speed of this craft.

i will never doubt anyones stories about u.F.O.'s ever again! i only bring this experience to this site because others that have witnessed something like this would not make fun of it or me ...

i now watch the sky on clear nights in hopes of seeing something this amazing again real soon!

respectfully,

richard m.
content.summary: Satallite gazing

content.detailedDescription:
My sister, brother-in-law, and i were sitting in their backyard sat night into sun morning hanging out cause it was a nice night. we look through the tree line and see the moon, and a super bright star-like object to the right of the moon. the object was moving, yet it was moving so slow it took 2 hours for it to pass to the right into the tree line. we even joked saying at one point it must be beaming somebody up, because, at one point, there was a bright light that came down from the object. 

the next day my sister called me and told me she was looking for anything on the internet that might tell us what we were staring at all night. she found nothing, until a couple days later when she found four seperate reports of ufo activity. that is what brings me to this site right now.

i believe i have seen a ufo in the past, however, it was more of a fireball look and disappeared quickly from the sky. this was very different.

i hope i gave a detailed enough description of that night.
content.summary: Brighter than bright star-like appearance

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
I woke up at approximately 4:20 am on june 3rd, 2008. as i laid there looking out the window next to my bed (a large casement window 5'x5'  & faces due north & gives me a panoramic view of the sky beyond the tree line at the back of our property) i saw a small gray cloud off in the distance. the rest of the sky was clear, no other clouds, & you could still see the stars. as i stared out at the sky i noticed the small cloud was moving closer in my direction at a very slow speed. the closer it got the more it didn't look like a cloud & began to take a definite shape, that of an elongated hexagon, dark gray in color just a shade darker then the backdrop of the sky. i could not say how high it was because there was nothing in the foreground to compare it to.  also, this object was very large, which made it very hard to tell its size or how high it was. if i had to guess, i would say if it was at an altitude of about 600 ft, its size was well over 100 ft. wide & long, with two of the sides slightly longer.  if it was at an altitude of about 1000 ft., this thing was immense. as i got out of bed & went to the window (which was open) i noticed there was no sound coming from it, although it was only about 400 to 500 ft. from the back of my property, but because of its altitude i could still only see the bottom.  at that point it began to make a right hand turn toward the west & continued doing almost a 180 degree turn.  however it did not turn on a flat plane, but dipped slightly as it turned. i have never seen anything turn like that. the only way i could describe it was a very fluid sliding turn.  as it turned, i could see that above the bottom there was a single rectangular light panel or window on each of its sides, i am assuming all sides, but i only saw three as it turned. these windows or panels were very dimly lit, just a shade lighter then the backdrop of the sky & i could not make out any framework or detail above. after the turn it went back at about a 15 degree angle from the direction it came & went a short distance, made another right turn, & came back along the same line it originally came on toward the south.  it must have been gaining altitude because it started to look smaller. from the time it was over my back yard until it made its final turn, was less then a minute or so, but seemed like eternity. all i could think was "i can't be seeing this" or "its not really happening"!  as it approached & was just about to cross over our house, it got distorted like looking across a hot asphalt road or something giving off a lot of heat like a grill, & then it was gone! by the time i got out my front door on the other side of the house, there was nothing but clear sky, stars, & not a cloud in sight.  running to the front door woke my wife up (she sleeps in another bedroom because i snore) i said to her, "you won't believe what i just saw"!  and she didn't!.

p.S. the following day, june 4, 2008, i called our local newspaper the intelligencer, to see if anyone called about seeing anything strange in the sky the night before. they said they hadn't received any, but put a reporter on the phone (freda r. savana, who covers my area). she wanted to know why i asked, did i see something i wanted to talk about? i told her basically what i wrote above, but did not give her my name. i told her i might call back in a few weeks to see if anyone else called to report something similar to what i saw. i decided to file this report with mufon, when i saw an article in the paper & newscast on channel 3, about people reporting seeing strange crafts in bucks county, pa. i am including my name & contact numbers, but want to be assured my identity will be kept strictly confidential at this time. the only people that know of this incident are my immediate family, & i would like to keep it that way.  thank you.  the photos below are not real done on computer.
content.summary: See below

content.detailedDescription:
On sunday july, 6th 2008, my 2 friends and i were on our way back home yesterday after an outing. it was about 5:15 pm and we were turning right onto old coleridge rd off of manor rock rd., when we witnessed what looked like an enormous solid black v hovering in the shallow valley area, over the back side of the ridge i live on. sitting in the back seat was xxxx, she is a federal agent and she had a clear view of the object at hand. i was sitting in the passenger seat and took the pictures through the vehicle since i still had my camera around my neck from taking pictures earlier in the afternoon. xxx was driving and didn't see anything but the road ahead! i've included the two photos that i took, once i realized we were seeing something unusual.  i could see the objects as they began dispersing very quickly in different directions. xxxx was straining to see the larger object, to closer identify it before loosing sight because of the tree line. as we were rounding the bend in the road, i witnessed an object shooting away to the south at incredible speed, as we turned back into viewing range the large object was gone, but several smaller objects in various shapes and sizes appeared and disappeared as they dispersed in different directions. there was one bird in the air at the time.  xxxx could not conclusivly identify the large object.
 
i believe that the valley behind my property is a "hot spot" for some reason. this is my first hardcore visual sighting of the object(s) that seem to be attracted to our area.
content.summary: Witnessed very large triangle shape that dispersed into several individual crafts

content.detailedDescription: I was up later than usual and went out on my porch overlooking sebago lake to smoke a ciggarette. i noticed what looked like an extremely bright star, but then realized it couldn't have been a star as i had never, ever seen one this bright. i grabbed my binoculars and got a closer look - it was hard to see cuz it was night time but i could see the object was like 2 white orbs on top of each other, and it was hovering stationary over the lake! there was no noise. all of a sudden, a red orb appears directly below the white orb and starts flying around at incredible speed. i watched for several seconds in disbelief and then ran upstairs to grab my camera, which has a crappy video mode also. i was able to capture about 15 seconds (the limit on my camera) of the red orb (the white one wasn't easily visible against the backdrop of the stars). i could tell the two objects were miles away, but the red orb moved across the lake in a split second - it must have been moving at thousands of miles per hour. soon afterwards the red orb appeared to go above the white, stationary orb and then disappeared from view. i was shocked. the video attached is very low quality and only the red orb is visible moving around. i have no idea whether this was a camera defect but it was not a firefly - that was what i thought originally until it was obviously acting under intelligent control and interacting with the white orb.
content.summary: Two bright objects over sebago lake - obviously not aircraft
